metadata.title: CVE-2021-29952 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When Web Render components were destructed, a race condition could havecaused undefined behavior, and we presume that with enough effort may havebeen exploitable to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox< 88.0.1 and Firefox for Android < 88.1.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29952` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
